A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie was not that good. I'm saying not that good because it is still watchable and enjoyable in some individual parts\, but as a whole\, the plot was completely asinine\, the majority of the characters shallow and dull\, the obvious copying of Episode V and VI (literally a sequence which is exactly like Episode VI when the Millennium Falcon goes to destroy the Death Star\, except its shaded red) made it feel like a cheap knockoff rather than a fresh new movie\, and there were so many immersion breaking parts that you don't even feel like you're watching Star Wars at all\, but a lame rendition of Space Balls.\n\nIts a movie that everyone is going to watch simply because it is labeled Star Wars\, but a large majority of the people I've spoken to who've watched it agree that its simply not up to the level we expect. I hope the series can redeem itself in the next movie though I won't be holding my breath.
